lines: I'm a Lead Software Engineer with a passion for building clean, intuitive, and high-performing applications. Since 2016, I’ve been helping teams bring ideas to life—designing scalable systems, solving complex problems, and delivering products that create real impact.
At UnitedHealth Group – Optum, I currently lead initiatives aimed at improving healthcare access for millions of people across the U.S.

Beyond engineering, I also contribute as a Solution Architect, crafting technical strategies and system designs that align with both business needs and long-term vision. I believe in building with purpose—solutions that are thoughtful, future-ready, and truly meaningful.
When I'm not coding, I’m exploring new technologies and writing about tech, programming, and how innovation can shape the future of healthcare.

articles.title: Understanding Blockchain — And Why It Matters for Innovation
articles.description: If you’ve been following the buzz around digital innovation, you’ve probably heard the term blockchain thrown around a lot. It sounds technical, even mysterious, but at its core, blockchain is a simple yet powerful technology that’s transforming the way we handle trust, data, and transparency.

articles.title: Transforming Provider Credentialing with AI and Blockchain: My Patent Journey
articles.description: One of the biggest challenges in U.S. healthcare today lies in how we verify and manage healthcare provider information. Whether it’s patients searching for in-network doctors, insurance companies trying to process claims accurately, or providers going through tedious credentialing processes, the current system is fragmented, outdated, and inefficient.

articles.title: Why It’s So Hard to Manage Healthcare Provider Data in One Place in the USA
articles.description: Imagine trying to put together a giant puzzle where every piece comes from a different company, a different city, and even a different rulebook. That’s what it’s like trying to manage healthcare provider data in the United States.

articles.title: Can Technology Heal What’s Broken in U.S. Healthcare?
articles.description: Let’s face it — healthcare in the U.S. can feel like a maze. You get sick, try to find the right doctor, figure out if they take your insurance, wait weeks for an appointment, and then get hit with a confusing bill. It’s stressful. It’s expensive. And for a country as advanced as the U.S., it shouldn’t be this hard.

articles.title: What is an AI Agent and How Is It Used?
articles.description: We hear about Artificial Intelligence (AI) everywhere these days — from Siri helping us send texts, to chatbots answering questions on websites, to cars that practically drive themselves. But behind many of these smart systems is something called an AI Agent. Sounds a little sci-fi, right? Don’t worry — let’s break it down in a way that makes sense.

articles.title: The Role of AI in Modern Healthcare
articles.description: Artificial Intelligence, or AI, isn’t just a fancy tech term anymore. It’s actually making a big difference in the real world, especially in healthcare. From helping doctors find problems faster to making patient care more personal, AI is changing the way we experience healthcare. In this article, I will explain how AI is used in healthcare, using simple and easy-to-understand examples.

articles.title: Angular’s Selectorless Components — A Clean Way to Reuse Logic
articles.description: Angular is always improving, and one of the newer features that developers are starting to notice is selectorless components. If you’re building large, reusable UIs and want more control over your HTML structure, this feature is worth checking out.

articles.title: How AI is Changing the Way We Code (And Why It’s Pretty Awesome)
articles.description: Lately, I’ve been thinking about how much the developer world has changed in just the past couple of years, especially with AI stepping into our daily workflows. It’s honestly wild how fast things are moving.

articles.title: The Impact of AI on Modern App User Interfaces
articles.description: The way we interact with apps today is drastically different from just a few years ago. We’re no longer tapping through rigid menus or waiting for static pages to load. Now, apps feel more alive — learning from us, adapting to us, and even talking back. What’s behind this transformation? One big driver is Artificial Intelligence (AI).

articles.title: Leveraging GraphQL for Healthcare Provider Data
articles.description: We know how critical accurate and structured provider data is in today’s digital healthcare systems. Whether it’s helping patients connect with the right doctors, managing complex provider directories, or supporting insurance networks, backend systems must be fast, scalable, and adaptable.We know how critical accurate and structured provider data is in today’s digital healthcare systems.

articles.title: Understanding Angular Standalone Components
articles.description: If you’ve been working with Angular, you probably know the usual drill: you create a component, and then you add it to a module. It’s like the component needs a home (the module) before it can exist in your app. But guess what? With the introduction of standalone components in Angular 14, that’s no longer a strict rule.

articles.title: How Powerful GraphQL Is: Combining Multiple APIs into One Unified Interface
articles.description: GraphQL has completely changed how I approach APIs. I used to think of it as a nice-to-have — a buzzword from dev conferences. But the moment I used it to unify multiple data sources into one clean API layer, I was sold. In this intro guide, I break down what GraphQL is, how it compares with REST

articles.title: Revolutionizing Healthcare Provider Search: Enhancing Access and Efficiency
articles.description: In today’s fast-paced digital world, finding the right healthcare provider should be as seamless as ordering a meal or booking a flight. However, many patients still face significant hurdles in identifying the best providers for their needs. A robust and user-friendly healthcare provider search system is essential to ensure that individuals can access quality care without unnecessary delays.

articles.title: How a Simple and Smart UI Can Make Finding Healthcare Providers Easier
articles.description: Let’s be honest — searching for a healthcare provider online can be frustrating. You’re already dealing with health concerns, and the last thing you need is a clunky website with confusing menus, endless clicks, and outdated information. A well-designed, intuitive user interface (UI) can change all that, making it easier and faster to find the right doctor. Here’s how:

articles.title: Improving Access to Healthcare: The Role of AI in Provider Search
articles.description: In the evolving landscape of healthcare, one of the most significant challenges is ensuring that individuals can easily find the right healthcare providers. Access to quality healthcare is not just about the availability of services but also the ease of locating them. In my previous articles, I discussed how a smart UI design can simplify this process

articles.title: AI-Based Provider Matching: Transforming Healthcare Access
articles.description: In my previous article, Improving Access to Healthcare: The Role of AI in Provider Search, I discussed how AI is reshaping the way patients find healthcare providers. Expanding on that, this article explores AI-based provider matching and how it enhances personalization and efficiency in healthcare access.

articles.title: Angular 19 Signals: A New Era of Reactivity
articles.description: If you’re an Angular developer, you’ve probably heard the buzz around Signals in Angular 19. And let me tell you, this is a game-changer! Angular has always been great, but Signals bring in a whole new level of fine-grained reactivity, making state management smoother, more efficient, and way more predictable.

articles.title: Getting Started with GraphQL: A Modern API Approach
articles.description: If you’ve ever worked with REST APIs, you know the struggle — over-fetching data, multiple endpoints, and juggling unnecessary responses. Enter GraphQL, the modern solution developers love for its flexibility and efficiency.

articles.title: Fixing the Mess in Healthcare Provider Search: What’s Wrong and How We Can Solve It
articles.description: Ever tried searching for a doctor online, only to find out their address is outdated, they’re not accepting new patients, or — worse — they’re not even in your insurance network? You’re not alone. Government reports from CMS, ASPE, and state agencies show that nearly half of provider directories contain errors. That’s a huge problem when people rely on these directories for care.

articles.title: Building a Unified Provider Directory: Reshaping Healthcare for Providers
articles.description: In today’s complex healthcare system, providers struggle to keep their information accurate and up to date across multiple directories. Poor data management creates extra work, slows down care coordination, and can lead to compliance issues. A single, unified provider directory can simplify the process and make things more efficient for healthcare providers.

articles.title: How Are Healthcare Providers Being Registered Today?
articles.description: I’ve been thinking about how healthcare providers get registered and how that whole process works. It’s actually pretty interesting and important, especially when you think about how millions of people rely on these systems to find doctors and specialists.

articles.title: Why Choose React?
articles.description: React is one of the most popular JavaScript libraries for building user interfaces, especially for single-page applications. React allows to create reusable UI components that can manage complex interactions in a scalable and efficient way. Whether you're a seasoned developer or a beginner, React’s component-based architecture and declarative syntax make it a versatile tool for building modern web applications.

certificates.title: CS50: Introduction to Computer Science
certificates.subtitle: Edx HarvardX
certificates.description: This is a course of study offered by HarvardX, an online learning initiative of Harvard University through edX.

certificates.title: Computer Science 101
certificates.subtitle: Stanford University
certificates.description: This is a course of study offered by Stanford University, an online learning initiative of Stanford University Stanford Online.

certificates.title: Databricks Accredited Generative AI Fundamentals
certificates.subtitle: Databricks
certificates.description: This certification validates foundational knowledge of generative AI, including core concepts, models, applications, and ethical considerations, empowering professionals to understand and engage with emerging AI technologies.

certificates.title: Advanced Machine Learning Operations
certificates.subtitle: Databricks
certificates.description: This certification validates expertise in deploying, monitoring, and managing ML models at scale using Databricks, focusing on MLOps best practices, automation, and collaborative workflows.

certificates.title: Graph Developer - Professional
certificates.subtitle: Apollo Graphql
certificates.description: This certification demonstrate strong familiarity with Apollo Federation concepts. They can apply those concepts to build a federated supergraph or move an existing monolithic graph to federation.

certificates.title: Graph Developer - Associate
certificates.subtitle: Apollo Graphql
certificates.description: This certification demonstrates foundational knowledge of GraphQL and Apollo, including schema design, running Apollo Server 4, and performing frontend queries using Apollo Client 3.

certificates.title: API Orchestration - Associate
certificates.subtitle: Apollo Graphql
certificates.description: This certification demonstrates foundational knowledge of API orchestration with Apollo Connectors, enabling REST API integration, selection mapping transformation, and orchestrating multiple REST calls using entities within a GraphQL schema.

certificates.title: AWS Certified Developer - Associate
certificates.subtitle: Linkedin
certificates.description: This certification validates proficiency in developing, testing, deploying, and debugging AWS cloud applications, requiring one or more years of hands-on experience in developing and maintaining AWS-based applications.

certificates.title: AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Professional
certificates.subtitle: Linkedin
certificates.description: This certification validates advanced skills in designing distributed systems on AWS, targeting individuals with deep knowledge of AWS services, architecture best practices, and the ability to design scalable, reliable, and cost-effective solutions.

certificates.title: Machine Learning with Python: Foundations
certificates.subtitle: Linkedin
certificates.description: This course introduces core ML concepts using Python, covering data preprocessing, supervised and unsupervised learning, and model evaluation in a beginner-friendly manner.

certificates.title: Python: Working with REST and Web Data
certificates.subtitle: Linkedin
certificates.description: This course teaches how to access, retrieve, and process web data using APIs. Learn authentication, JSON parsing, and integration techniques for building real-world Python applications.

certificates.title: Legacy Front End
certificates.subtitle: Free Code Camp
certificates.description: This certification is a 300-hour program designed to teach the fundamentals of web development. This certification focuses on building a strong foundation in HTML, CSS, Responsive Web Design, JavaScript, and jQuery.

certificates.title: GraphQL for Enterprise Developers
certificates.subtitle: Linkedin
certificates.description: This course offers a practical guide to building scalable APIs using GraphQL, tailored for enterprise environments with real-world examples, advanced patterns, and performance optimization strategies.

certificates.title: Spring with GraphQL
certificates.subtitle: Linkedin
certificates.description: This course is designed for back-end and full-stack developers aiming to integrate GraphQL with Spring Boot. It covers building, maintaining, and evolving robust GraphQL APIs using the Spring Framework, including advanced topics like mutations, batching, telemetry, error handling, and API extension.

certificates.title: Introduction to MLSecOps
certificates.subtitle: LinkedIn
certificates.description: This course explores the fusion of machine learning and security operations, emphasizing secure ML lifecycle management, threat mitigation, and collaboration across data science, DevOps, and security teams.

certificates.title: Agentic AI Fundamentals: Architectures, Frameworks, and Applications
certificates.subtitle: LinkedIn
certificates.description: This course explores how autonomous AI agents are built, structured, and deployed, covering core architectures, popular frameworks, and real-world applications driving next-generation intelligent systems.

certificates.title: Artificial Intelligence and Application Security
certificates.subtitle: LinkedIn
certificates.description: This course explores how AI transforms cybersecurity, highlighting benefits, risks, and strategies for integrating intelligent systems into secure software development and threat mitigation practices.

certificates.title: Artificial Intelligence Foundations: Machine Learning
certificates.subtitle: LinkedIn
certificates.description: This course offers a beginner-friendly introduction to machine learning concepts, including supervised and unsupervised learning, model training, evaluation, and building ML pipelines.

certificates.title: Generative AI for Business Leaders
certificates.subtitle: LinkedIn
certificates.description: This course led by Tomer Cohen, LinkedIn’s Chief Product Officer. It equips executives with insights into generative AI's impact on business, covering applications, limitations, and strategies for leveraging this technology to drive innovation and efficiency.

certificates.title: Driving AI Adoption as a Business Leader
certificates.subtitle: LinkedIn
certificates.description: This course offers practical strategies for executives to integrate AI into business operations, overcome resistance, and lead successful, ethical, and scalable AI transformation initiatives.

certificates.title: Artificial Intelligence and Business Strategy
certificates.subtitle: LinkedIn
certificates.description: This course explores how AI enhances competitive advantage through data-driven strategies, personalized services, and operational efficiency.

certificates.title: Integrating Generative AI into Business Strategy
certificates.subtitle: LinkedIn
certificates.description: This course offers a concise, practical guide for organizations aiming to adopt generative AI effectively. The course introduces the USAGE framework—Understand, Survey, Align, Guide, Evaluate—providing actionable steps to align AI initiatives with business goals, assess readiness, and implement responsibly.

certificates.title: Amplify Your Business Writing with AI
certificates.subtitle: LinkedIn
certificates.description: This course offers practical strategies to enhance clarity, creativity, and efficiency in business communication by integrating artificial intelligence tools effectively.

certificates.title: Generative AI and Large Language Models on AWS
certificates.subtitle: LinkedIn
certificates.description: This course teaches setting up cloud-based Rust environments, building serverless workflows with AWS Lambda and Step Functions, and using tools like AWS CodeCatalyst, SageMaker, and Amazon Bedrock for model orchestration and data workflows.

certificates.title: Generative AI: Introduction to Large Language Models
certificates.subtitle: LinkedIn
certificates.description: This course offers a beginner-friendly overview of generative AI tools like ChatGPT and DALL·E, explaining their functions and roles within the AI ecosystem.

certificates.title: Blockchain: Beyond the Basics
certificates.subtitle: LinkedIn
certificates.description: This course explores advanced blockchain concepts, applications across industries, emerging trends, and future possibilities, offering a deeper understanding for professionals seeking practical, real-world insights.

certificates.title: Blockchain: Learning Solidity
certificates.subtitle: LinkedIn
certificates.description: This course offers a beginner-friendly guide to mastering Solidity, the programming language essential for developing smart contracts on the Ethereum blockchain, with practical, hands-on examples.

certificates.title: Programming Foundations: Design Patterns
certificates.subtitle: LinkedIn
certificates.description: This course introduces essential object-oriented design patterns like Strategy, Adapter, Observer, and Decorator, with practical Java examples and occasional insights in Python and JavaScript, ideal for intermediate developers.​

certificates.title: Javascript (Basic)
certificates.subtitle: Hacker Rank
certificates.description: This certification possess a basic knowledge on Javascript which covers topics like, Functions, Currying, Hoisting, Scope, Inheritance, Events and Error Handling.

certificates.title: Angular (Basic)
certificates.subtitle: Hacker Rank
certificates.description: This certification possess a basic knowledge on Angular which covers topics like MVC Frameworks, Components (Angular, Dynamic, Styling), TypeScript, Two Way Binding and Form Validation.

courses: Algorithm and Programming with Data Structures

experiences.title: Sr Software Engineer - Team Lead
experiences.description: UnitedHealth Group is a health care and well-being company with team members in two distinct and complementary businesses - Optum and UnitedHealthcare - working to help build a modern, high-performing health system.

projects.projectDescription: Currently leading a federated team to develop and enhance the Optum Provider Search Experience — a key product used by millions of people to help patients easily find and connect with healthcare providers within the Optum network. This platform offers a user-friendly, dynamic search tool that allows users to filter providers based on multiple criteria such as location, specialty, language, and gender, making it easier for patients to access the right care. By improving the search functionality and overall user experience, the product plays a critical role in empowering millions of patients and streamlining healthcare access.

Led a team in developing user interface applications for the Optum Data Exchange platform, a critical system that facilitates the secure and efficient exchange of clinical data between healthcare providers. Focused on enhancing the platform's usability and performance, enabling providers to access and share patient data seamlessly. This work directly supports the healthcare industry's transition to more integrated and data-driven care, improving patient outcomes and operational efficiency.

experiences.title: Software Developer
experiences.description: Egen Solutions is an enterprise web and mobile application development firm dedicated to build better user experiences at the for front of design. Egen also has an IT Talent Acquisition division and places highly skilled tech professionals in companies across the US.

projects.projectName: Client Onboaring - Raymond James Financial, Inc.
projects.projectDescription: Contributed to the development and enhancement of the Client Onboarding application — a mission-critical, web-based platform used by Raymond James Financial Advisors and internal teams to efficiently open, manage, and maintain client profiles and financial accounts. Played a key role in implementing new features, optimizing workflows, and ensuring regulatory compliance, resulting in a more streamlined and user-friendly onboarding experience. The platform supports thousands of users daily and is integral to the firm's client relationship management and operational efficiency.

experiences.title: Application Developer
experiences.description: Kent State University is a large, primary residential, public research university in Kent, Ohio. It has serval IT divisions which services on software solutions to the Organization. The application Service Request Management is a part of Technology Department at University College which supports day-to-day jobs of managing a wide range of requests such as IT support requests, project requests, service requests, application development requests, media design requests, etc. from internal and external clients.

projects.projectDescription: Developed and enhanced a comprehensive Service Request Management application for the Technology Department at University College. The platform streamlined the intake, tracking, and resolution of diverse requests — including IT support, project management, application development, media design, and other technical services — from both internal and external stakeholders. The system significantly improved operational efficiency by centralizing request workflows, automating status updates, and enabling better resource allocation. This solution played a key role in supporting the department’s day-to-day operations and elevating service delivery standards across the college.
